value.title: Preventing Data Silos with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick and Kalyn look at data silos and how to prevent it using Power BI. Different options exist, such as Analysis Services, Azure Analysis Services or models hosted in the Power BI service.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can create report level measures, within Power BI Desktop, against SQL Server Analysis Services Tabular live connections, or against a Power BI service dataset live connection. He also explains what is meant by report level measures. Bust out your DAX toolbelt

value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited
value.excerpt: We had some recent changes to Row-level security in Power BI. Row-level security (RLS) was moved to be configured in Power BI Desktop with the June 2016 release.  I walk through how you could can configure this now in Power BI Desktop. I also talk about some of the limitations.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in

value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/dax/coalesce-function-dax  SQLBI.com article:  https://sql.bi/659297   📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.excerpt: Power BI Apps are a terrific way to distribute your Power BI content to a large audience.  You can "Publish App" to Entire Organization or specific individuals and groups.
